reviewText: Dale Hardshovel HD is a pretty good puzzle game, needs bit more polish with graphics but the puzzles are very challenging which will keep you thinking.  You only need a mouse to play this game and its very easy to manoeuvre the puzzles. Would recommend it to people who like puzzle games as it can keep you busy for hours on end.
voteText: 9 of 13 people (69%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Dale Hardshovel HD is a good puzzle game. The controls are simple: you move the artifacts horizontaly with the mouse. You need to match the artifacts, in pairs of 2 or 3 artifacts, in the given time to be able to complete the level.

A little more info about matching: for the matching to count they have to be next to each other in a stay" position...if you swipe an artifact over more artifacts and there is one of same model under it won't count as a match. Also if an artifact is on the moving platform and another of same time on the ledge near the moving platform when they will be next to each other it won't count as match.

The complexity of levels differ based on the things you'll find in them: from movable blocks that will help you to get over holes
date: spikes that will destroy your artifacts
recommended: blocks which dissapear after you passed them a number of times to teleporters
hoursPlayed: moving platforms(which can't keep more than one artifact at a time)
voteText: magnets and switches.\n\nAs a side note
helpfulPercent: for long play sessions the soundtrack may become a bit annoying because it gets repetitive."

reviewText:
- This review isn't written by a native speaker, thank you for your understanding -

Rating between Good and Must Play

- Key features below ---- Review after -----------------------------------------------
Play time needed (perfect) about 6 hours or more
Gaming level between Casual (+) and Puzzler (-)
Achievement level between Casual (+) and Puzzler (-)
Game style Puzzle, Matching
Game modes Main story, 2 additional worlds (Halloween and Christmas)
Story A small one.
Voice No.
Music Yes, one ?
Controls Mouse only.
Tutorial Yes.
Unmissable / backtracking content Yes.
Glitches / bugs Yes, needed. Refer to (*) below.
Worth price Full price.

- Review below ----------------------------------------------------------------------
Dale Hardshovel HD is the remastered edition of Dale Hardshovel, mostly the graphics and the additional worlds are different. The levels didn't changed.

This game is a matching game, the aim is to clear all items of a level by matching twins or trios of the same item in a limited amount of time. It remember me this kind of game, he it's not that one, on the first mobile phone with a color screen.

The mechanisms of the game are easy to learn and master, some levels are really challenging. There are also some environments to be aware of or to use, such as: weak blocks, sticky black oil, moving spikes, portals, magnet...

(*):
There is only one main glitch that is required in order to finish some levels. In one level you need to pause the game while using a moving platform to save time. Without doing that, you are always running out of time.

This is still a great game to play, and I recommend to use my guide if needed to finish the game or getting the achievements.

reviewText:
It is a broken remake piece of **** of a 5? year old game.

Contrary to the gameplay video your timer counts down from a set number and when it reaches 0 you lose, good luck finishing a level where you have 2 minutes and the (old) youtube walkthrough takes 3:55.

Maybe it is a difficult setting but that doesent matter since there are no options (that work)

There is a way to finish each level thou... you can still move the objects around if you pause the game... but that is not a feature" i praise.

request refund immediately"
